items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: With Mild Weather to Start Week, Natural Gas Cash Clunks
items.summary: Next-day spot gas prices lost ground on Monday as benign near-term weather outweighed expectations for expansive cold shots later this month. NGI’s Spot Gas National Avg. was down 9.5 cents on the day to $2.575/MMBtu after advancing 10.0 cents to clo

items.title: Futures Settle: February Natural Gas Amasses Momentum Amid Fresh Signs of Strong Heating Demand
items.summary: Colder weather patterns and the potential for increased storage draws in the back half of winter sent natural gas futures into rally mode on Monday.

items.title: Texas Natural Gas, Oil Operators ‘Adjusting, Not Breaking’ as LNG, AI Growth Continues
items.summary: The Lone Star State’s natural gas and oil operators are heading into 2026 with confidence that rising power demand from data centers, increasing LNG exports and continued population growth may offset concerns about global oversupply.

items.title: Midday Snapshot: Natural Gas Cash Prices Slipping Amid Near-Term Weather Weakness
items.summary: In contrast to a futures rally driven by colder two-week forecast trends, natural gas spot prices slipped through midday Monday on adequate supply and a mild immediate-term weather outlook.

items.title: U.S. LNG Flows Anchor Global Gas Markets as Europe Competes, Asia Pulls Back
items.summary: Global natural gas benchmarks are stabilizing after a soft start to the year as chilly weather settles over Europe, but steady LNG supply and muted Asian demand are keeping a lid on the upward movement.

items.title: Agua Dulce Prices Recede From Early Winter Highs as Export Demand Looms
items.summary: Agua Dulce cash prices took a sharp turn Friday, falling 33.0 cents to settle at $2.220/MMBtu. The retreat followed early winter peaks of $4.500, signaling a cooling of spot demand even as the hub's long-term profile as an export gateway strengthens.

items.title: Modest Natural Gas Storage Draw Seen Widening Surplus Amid Winter Warmth
items.summary: NGI is projecting an 86 Bcf withdrawal from Lower 48 underground natural gas storage for the week ended Jan. 9.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Bullish Forecasts Boosting Natural Gas
items.summary: As weather models added heating demand, natural gas futures rebounded from recent weakness through midday Monday.

items.title: ‘Mixed’ Year Ahead for Midcon Natural Gas, Oil Investments as Activity Slumps
items.summary: Energy investments across the Midcontinent are forecast to be mixed this year, following dismal drilling and business activity during the final three months of 2025, according to the Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City.

items.title: Why Oil Majors Are Hesitant to Invest in Post-Maduro Venezuela
items.summary: The U.S. stood the energy world on its ear with the “wee-hours” takedown of the Maduro regime just as the New Year began. One of the principal aims of the administration was made abundantly clear in the press conference that detailed the stunning shi

items.title: Cheap Oil Is Double-Edged Sword for Trump
items.summary: One of the campaign promises of President Donald Trump was to secure affordable energy for Americans. Even at the time, this promise put him at odds with the oil industry, already suffering from low oil prices. Now, the rift has deepened as the prosp

items.title: Trump’s Venezuela Gambit Could Erode OPEC’s Clout in Oil Markets
items.summary: For the past year, surging oil production from the Americas – led by the United States, Guyana, and Brazil – has been a headache for OPEC in its efforts to rebalance the market and seek higher oil prices. OPEC’s efforts to continue influencing global

items.title: BHP Expected to Wait Out Rio Glencore Deal Talks as Copper M&A Heats Up
items.summary: Australia's mining giant, BHP Group ( NYSE:BHP), will wait out talks over the proposed merger by the United Kingdom’s Rio Tinto Group (NYSE:RIO) and Switzerland-based commodity trading and mining company Glencore Plc. (OTCPK:GLCNF), people familiar w

items.title: Germany Seals $9.6B TenneT Deal to Ease Power Grid Bottlenecks
items.summary: Germany has finalized a deal to buy a stake in the German division of Dutch power grid operator TenneT (TenneT Germany) for around €7.6–€8.9 billion (approx. $8.2–$9.6 billion), locking in some state influence over critical high-voltage infrastructur

items.title: Trump Tells Cuba to Make a Deal After Severing Its Oil Lifeline
items.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump on Jan. 11 told Cuba that it should forge a deal with the United States now that Washington has pushed Venezuela to cut off its supply of oil and money to the communist-run island. After the U.S. military captured Venezuel
